Career Profile

I am currently an undergraduate student at Muhlenberg College pursuing a B.S. in Biology with two minors in Public Health and Sustainable Studies.

As a senior, I'm looking at doctoral programs. My research interests are still broad and include: ecology, animal development and how it depends on abiotic elements in its environment,and development of sustainable models.

Experience

Laboratory Technician for Microbiology Laboratory

Fall 2015-Present
Muhlenberg College, PA

Prepare all the weekly supplies for the laboratory: media, plates, bacterial cultures, and autoclaving biohazardous materials and waste.

Tour Guide

Fall 2013 - Present
Muhlenberg College, PA

Awarded one of 50 available positions from a pool of over 100 applicants to act as a liaison between the admissions staff and the prospective students. Apply interpersonal skills through interactions with prospective students to showcase the academic and social atmospheres, and to promote extracurricular activities as well as educational resources on campus.

Recitation Leader for National Science Foundation Grant

Fall 2016
Muhlenberg College, PA

Independently, taught a weekly science class for first-year students. This class was affiliated with the Introduction to Biology lecture and was funded through a Nation Science Foundation grant aimed at promoting the retention of under-represented students in the sciences. Prepared and presented topics related to adjusting to college and preparing for exams, focusing on reviewing class material and establishing efficient study habits. Instructed students on the basics of experimental design and understanding primary literature.

Laboratory Assistant for Introductory Biology

Fall 2016
Muhlenberg College, PA

Assisted in teaching content-related material in the laboratory classroom, led review sessions, and assisted with maintenance of materials such as: loading and running gels, centrifuging, insect colony maintenance.

Research

Undergraduate Research

Data Analysis

2015 - Present
Muhlenberg College, PA

Analyzing data collected during summers 2015 and 2016 by completing area analysis in ImageJ, calculating averages, standard deviation, and preparing graphs in Excel, in addition to reading, interpreting, and writing primary literature. This work has culminated into an archived paper at the University of Washington and multiple research posters and talks.

The Effects of Reduced Salinity on the Green Sea Urchin (Lytechinus variegatus)

Fall 2016
Muhlenberg College, PA

Investigated the effects of reduced salinity on the green sea urchin (Lytechinus variegatus) under a scanning electron microscope. This research has been presented in a college-wide poster session.

Feeding Preferences of Freshwater Isopods (Lirceus sp.)

Spring 2015
Muhlenberg College, PA

Conducted experiments in a laboratory setting to determine whether freshwater isopods (Lirceus sp.) preferred fine-particulate organic material or coarse-particulate organic material as a habitat. This research included collecting isopods in the stream, maintaining the animals, and reading primary literature. Ultimately, this work culminated to a research poster at a regional conference.

Field Research

The Effects of Climate Change on Two Terrestrial Slugs (Ariolimax columbianus and Arion rufus)

Summer 2016
Friday Harbor Labs, WA

Independent researcher, advised by Erika V. Iyengar. This work, regarding the effects of climate change on two terrestrial slug species (Ariolimax columbianus and Arion rufus), will be incorporated into Biology Honors Thesis. This research has also resulted in multiple poster sessions.

The Competitive Relationship Between Two Terrestrial Slugs Ariolimax columbianus and Arion rufus

Summer 2015
Friday Harbor Labs, WA

Nation Science Foundation awarded position (Research Experience for Undergraduates), guided by Erika V. Iyengar. This research explored whether there was a competitive relationship between two terrestrial slug species (Ariolimax columbianus and Arion rufus) by analyzing feeding habits. This work culminated has culminated in multiple poster sessions and research talks.

Mayol M and Iyengar EV.
2015
